meanings.definition: A person responsible for the supervision of a particular place or group of people.
meanings.sent1: The warden of the school made sure all students were safe during the fire drill.
meanings.sent2: The warden of the building checked everyone's ID before allowing them to enter.
meanings.sent3: The warden of the zoo had to keep a close eye on the mischievous monkeys.
meanings.sent4: As the warden of the library, she guarded the books like precious treasures.
meanings.sent5: The warden of the castle was known for his strict but fair leadership.

meanings.definition: A person in charge of the maintenance and protection of a forest, park, or other natural area.
meanings.sent1: The warden of the national park ensured that the trails were clear for visitors.
meanings.sent2: The warden of the forest planted new trees to help preserve the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The warden of the wildlife sanctuary rescued a baby deer stuck in a bush.
meanings.sent4: The warden of the nature reserve was like a guardian angel for the animals.
meanings.sent5: The warden of the botanical garden had a green thumb and nurtured every plant with care.

meanings.definition: A person in charge of a prison.
meanings.sent1: The warden of the prison conducted regular inspections of the cells.
meanings.sent2: The warden of the correctional facility oversaw the daily routines of the inmates.
meanings.sent3: The warden of the jail had to deal with a comical escape attempt by a group of squirrels.
meanings.sent4: The warden of the penitentiary was like a key that kept the dangerous criminals locked away.
meanings.sent5: The warden of the maximum-security prison had eyes that could see through any deception.
